dt: {bc}to choke to death by compressing the throat with something (such as a hand or rope) {bc}{sx|throttle||}
{bc}to obstruct seriously or fatally the normal breathing of
{bc}to suppress or hinder the rise, expression, or growth of
{bc}to die from or as if from interference with breathing

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}estrangler{/it}, from Latin {it}strangulare{/it}, from Greek {it}strangalan{/it}, from {it}strangalē{/it} halter {ma}{mat|strain|}{/ma}
shortdef: to choke to death by compressing the throat with something (such as a hand or rope) : throttle
to obstruct seriously or fatally the normal breathing of

dt: {bc}any of several figs (such as {it}Ficus aurea{/it} of the southeastern U.S.) that start as epiphytes but send down roots to the ground around the host tree
{bc}any of various epiphytic vines or trees (such as {it}Clusia rosea{/it} synonym {it}C. major{/it}) of similar habit

shortdef: any of several figs (such as Ficus aurea of the southeastern U.S.) that start as epiphytes but send down roots to the ground around the host tree; broadly : any of various epiphytic vines or trees (such as Clusia rosea synonym C. major) of similar habit
